description: From Middle English tonsure, from Anglo-Norman and Old French tonsure, from Latin tonsūra (“a clipping, trimming”), from tondeō (“shear, clip, trim”).

entries.meaning: A ritual shaving of this kind.
The hairstyle and characteristic bald patch resulting from being tonsured.

verbs.description: tonsure (third-person singular simple present tonsures, present participle tonsuring, simple past and past participle tonsured)

entries.meaning: (Christianity, Buddhism) To shave the crown of the head as a sign of humility and religious vocation.
